page.title: 03THE TREFUSIS FAMILY
page.content: Mrs. Trefusis married into the family in 1940 and her grandson is the 28th generation of the family.The earliest record historians have of the Trefusis family living in Flushing goes back to the early 12th century, this is confirmed by the prefix Tre- which means pre-Norman times. The estate was larger in Norman times than it is now,although it is 1000 acres today it used to include Constantine and the surrounding area.They used to keep cows and bullocks and they had 1.5 acres of vegetables and flowers. During the war there was a lot of work done in the docks,there was a canteen in the village for the crews of the barrage balloons based in Flushing.
